DOC.brief_summary: Study compare caudal prolotherapy conventional steroid chronic low back pain
DOC.brief_title: Caudal Corticosteroid vs. Dextrose Injection Lumbosacral Radicular Pain .
DOC.criteria: INCLUSION CRITERIA 1 . Participants must satisfy diagnostic criterion lumbar radicular pain L4 nerve root level consistent MRI X ray finding . 2 . Evidence low back pain base upon one following : i. Lumbar back pain episode last great 6 month current pain level great 6/10 VAS . ii . Has receive l 2 type ancillary treatment ( i.e . physical therapy , oral analgesia , acupuncture , etc . ) 3 . Men woman age great equal 18 year . 4 . No significant alcohol use ( 7 few drink per week ) . 5 . Patient history least 2 failed epidural CS injection . EXCLUSION CRITERIA 1 . Treatment risk factor include one following : i. Unstable symptomatic cardiac complaint ii . Unstable symptomatic respiratory complaint iii . Unable reliably comprehend protocol reliably record data 2 . Pregnancy . A serum pregnancy test must perform negative woman child bear potential within 2 week prior enrollment . 3 . History Malignancy 4 . Any medical ( i.e . malignancy , infection , thromboembolic state , autoimmune disease , polyneuropathy ) psychosocial condition opinion investigator , could jeopardize subject 's participation , compliance study criterion .
